DOC.brief_summary: This retrospective study patient diagnose chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( COPD ) respiratory failure admit West China Hospital January 2014 March 2016 review medical record . The following variable retrospectively study : age , sex , marriage , height , weight , respiratory rate , PaO2 , PaCO2 , nutritional risk screening 2002 ( NRS 2002 ) score , ALB , short-term long-term prognostic outcome , . The purpose study compare predictive power three widely use nutritional assessment method ( BMI , NRS 2002 ALB ) predict prognostic outcome cohort COPD patient respiratory failure .
DOC.brief_title: A Comparison Three Nutritional Assessment Methods Predicting Prognosis COPD With Respiratory Failure
DOC.criteria: Newly diagnosis COPD West China Hospital January 2014 March 2016 Partial pressure O2 ( PaO2 ) < 60 mmHg and/or partial pressure CO2 ( PaCO2 ) > 50 mmHg Age â‰¥ 18 year Respiratory rate > 23 bpm Pregnancy lactation Ventilatory dysfunction due neuromuscular disorder , acute chronic thromboembolic disease , severe illness system Incomplete medical profile
